titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Artists Pamphlet Collection
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Arts Library Special Collections Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 00:02

did.abstract: The collection contains pamphlets, brochures, and other ephemera on individual artists published by museums, galleries, and other institutions throughout the world.

langmaterial.language: Chiefly in English with some materials in European and non-European languages.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Assembled over time by the Yale University Art and Architecture Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Artists Pamphlet Collection, Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library, Yale University.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Artists Pamphlet Collection was assembled over time by the Yale University Art and Architecture Library as a means of facilitating access to and use of printed ephemeral material about individual artists.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains pamphlets, brochures, and other ephemera on individual artists published by museums, galleries, and other institutions throughout the world. The majority of the materials are exhibition listings and catalogs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Individual bibliographic records were created in Orbis previously for the majority of the items in the collection and assigned the Orbis location Art and Architecture, Uncataloged A, and the call number xcat A[rtists]. These material are not shelved individually but are boxed in alphabetical order by artist name. Readers who have identified an item in Orbis that they wish to see should consult the box listing within the collection finding aid to determine which box should be requested through the Arts Library Special Collections department.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by artist name; within artist name arranged by title of publication.
